p: Subsequently, eligible participants were randomly assigned to two study groups, including herbal medicine or EA and the placebo. Random blocks were used for randomization. Since the size of the blocks was set at 4, six sequences were created. Random sequences were made by the statistician using random allocator software. The allocator concealed the block size from the executor; thus, the random allocation of the participants was assured. It must be noted that, based on the method of the study, which was a double-blind clinical trial, neither the executor nor the participants were aware of the type of the consumed drugs. In addition, executors did not participate in data analysis.
